boardgame.name: Rail Baron
boardgame.description: Rail Baron is one of the earlier train games - boardgames with a railroad theme._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players move trains along historical USA railroad lines and collect delivery payoffs. They compete to purchase the railroads in order to assemble a network that gives access to important map destinations while simultaneously trying to prevent their opponents from doing so._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;From the Box (Avalon Hill Bookshelf Game)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Only in America!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;You are living in the heyday of the locomotive. You are Jay Gould. And you have just added another railroad to your vast railroad empire. Flushed with success, you now retire to the sartorial splendor of your very own Pullman Palace Car. The dream ends. You awaken to reality with the thought... _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;just another fantasy._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; Ahh, but for the grace of Avalon Hill, you dream continues._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Here, in Rail Baron, you become a latter day Gould, or a Cornelius Vanderbilt, or any of those menacingly infamous moguls whose wizardry and acumen established the criteria for which business success was to be judged in decades to come._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Rail Baron is played on a large board of the United States RR network. in fact, it comes in three separate boards. Laid end to end, it spell out America and portrays the 28 major rail lines and major cities they connected during the halcyon days of railroading._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;You start with $20,000 - and a train. You make money on trips from city to city. Pretty soon you've got enough money to build up your empire (you can buy the B_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp;O and C_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp;O for just $44,000). More holdings bring more money your way (track rental) from your opponents._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;With many new nuances of strategy, it becomes a game where fortunes see-saw until the last rail baron is bankrupt - or has accumulated the $200,000 needed to win._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;All of this may take 3 to 4 hours. But it's great fun for 3 to 6 people, ages 10 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; up._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Absolutely MINT condition. Still shrink-wrapped, no dings, dents or VERY minor shelf-wear on front of box. Price includes FREE SHIPPING in continental US, pro-rated shipping elsewhere. Pictures can be found at: http://www.northbound-train.com/games/RailBaron.html
Very good Condition. All components there. As good as you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d ask for a 20 year old game that has been opened and played.
Very clean, original owner. Complete. Box shows some shelf wear but not excessive. Components are in good condition. You can tell the game has been played but otherwise in very nice shape.
This game was a preorder.

The only thing that detracts from this game is the light wear on the box. Other than this, the game would have been listed as mint --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; All of the playing cards (Rail company title cards and train cards) are still not separated.

This popular, vintage Avalon Hill game is in its original shrinkwrap; cover has nice vibrant color. After purchasing, I decided I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m not so interested in the game, and want to make it available to someone who might really want a brand new copy. I will accept payment of $90 US as well. Don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t like the price? Make me an offer! I have US and European addresses for payment, but be aware the game will ship from the Netherlands, so shipping costs need to be considered. Please write to me for any other information you might need, and to arrange shipping and payment options.
Punched. Some Shelf wear

Complete, excellent condition. Box shows little to no shelfwear.
Played a lot, but components are in great shape. Box has wear, a split at one corner. Lid has bowing and some wear. Played l lot, but in better shape than you would expect.

Game is in very good shape. Only played on twice as it is a second copy for me. However it is missing two blue plastic chips to mark the starting and ending destinations of the blue player. Two replacement blue chips provided but they are a little bigger than the original chips.

The game has been played only once, the game material is like new, having hardly been played at all, but the box shows some shelfwear. Please take contact with me if you need further information. Open, but unpunched/unplayed.

very good condition

100% complete. Money and railroad deed cards are straight and crisp, with a beautiful gameboard. Rules are very slightly wrinkled. Box is in outstandining condition, with no damage and only a little shelfwear on the bottom. This is an excellent copy of a hard-to-find game.

Rail Baron The Game is complete – parts are sorted and bagged Board, cards, playing pieces in very good shape Rules have some yellowing Box shows wear on edges and corners

This copy of Rail Baron is 100% complete. Box is in excellent shape, with no split corners or rips or repairs. Board and cards are also in immaculate condition. Only damage to game is a cup stain on the back of the payoff chart.

CLS Games - Atlanta_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Boardgame Warehouse - is the largest retailer of board games in metro Atlanta! RAIL BARON: 99.95 each (2 copies available) Avalon Hill (1977) * Initial inspection indicates that the games are complete. However, they will be re-inspected prior to shipping and any deficiencies will be discussed with the buyer. Pictures of the games are included below. SHIPPING Continental U.S. - FedEx: $13.95 International (Including AK _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; HI) - USPS Priority Mail: TBD

If you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re a collector, read no further! This is a near playable copy of Rail Baron for someone that just really wants to play the game. Included are: - Rules - Payoff Chart - Map boards - Rail Line Title Cards - Money It is missing: - Box - Express Title Cards (there are supposed to be 6 of these; you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll need someone to make a scan) - Superchief Cards (there are supposed to be 6 of these: you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll need someone to make a scan) - Pawns and tokens (the game came with very generic pawns and tokens, so you can use anything as replacement) Basically, the only missing parts that are not easily replaceable are the box, express and superchief cards. Like I said earlier, a print-out of the missing cards would do you just fine though.

Like new [unplayed]..the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;title deed_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; (railroad ownership certificates) are unpunched, the AH money is brand new, the tokens are the original cheesy ones supplied by AH

Rail Baron Boardgame Used Complete No Handling Fee This game is complete! Game parts are in good condition, as explained in the list below. Contents: Three-section game board (Boards are just a bit loose at the fold, and one has a two-inch strip of cellophane tape to repair a small tear, but this does not affect game play and boards are very much usable) 28 Rail line title cards (Good condition. No creases or folds) 6 Express cards 6 Superchief cards (Express and Superchief cards in good condition, no folds or creases) 6 sets of colored tokens: each set having one pawn and two matching chips. (Complete) 2 white dice and one red die. Payoff chart: (Chart is well-thumbed, worn, torn at page edges and soiled a bit. But still readable and usable) Instructions (intact) Play Money as follows: 30--$500 bills 30--$1,000 bills 30--$5,000 bills 62--$10,000 bills 15--$50,000 bills For a total of $1,565,000 in play money. Note: a few of the bills seem to be faded a little bit, but still legible and usable. Game box is worn at edges and corners, but intact. No split corners and no tape! Note: there are also four plastic clips in the game which are not listed in the game rules. Buyer pays actual postage on three pounds shipping weight from my zip of 98338. No handling fee. I will ship world wide.

Box is solid and square. Moderate shelf wear. Rules underlined. Some replacement components (the home and destination chips don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t appear to be original), otherwise complete. ------------------- Due to high shipping costs and general amount of paper work involved, I am limiting the sale on this game to US only. This game is listed as part of a group that I am selling to benefit the Sun Tzu Military History Museum. The games were owned by friend who passed this past January, and he wanted to make sure his games were sold to benefit his charity of choice. Many of the games have rules underlining, which I have tried to catalog in the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s condition. I have also tried to give as complete and accurate description as possible. Games are complete, unless otherwise noted. A few of the older games may have handmade replacement counters. Again, I have tried to identify these items in the game description. If you are concerned about specifics of condition that are not in the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s description, please geekmail me, and I will give a very specific accounting of whatever you may have questions on. For any games that are missing pieces, I heartily recommend checking the BGG Spare Parts 2012 wanted/have geeklist. Several users of this site have been very generous in helping find missing components! http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/76707/2012-spare-parts-resource-list Prices are firm on single purchases, but I will consider offers on multiple games. I will ship multiple purchases together to try and save you money on shipping. Photos are available upon request! Local pickup available in the Denver Metro area. I live in South West Aurora and we can meet at a place that makes sense.
